alert.note: Alert for Gibson; Pike; Spencer; Warrick (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 29 at 8:10PM EDT until June 29 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: The National Weather Service in Paducah has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northern Warrick County in southwestern Indiana... North central Spencer County in southwestern Indiana... Southeastern Gibson County in southwestern Indiana... Southeastern Pike County in southwestern Indiana... * Until 800 PM CDT/900 PM EDT/. * At 710 PM CDT/810 PM EDT/, a severe thunderstorm was located near Lynnville, or near Oakland City, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Oakland City, Dale, Lynnville, Folsomville, Santa Claus, Elberfeld, Chrisney, Somerville, Tennyson, Gentryville, Spurgeon and Mackey. This includes the following highways... Interstate 69 in Indiana between Mile Markers 21 and 35. Interstate 64 in Indiana between Mile Markers 29 and 58. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
